doc.field: Bonnie Gordon using inventory created by Tamiment staff in 2011
Bonnie Gordon using inventory created by Tamiment staff in 2011
Workforce Development Institute Unseenamerica NYS Photographs
Workforce Development Institute Unseenamerica NYS Photographs
Unseenamerica NYS is a photography and writing workshop class offered to working men and women across New York by the Workforce Development Institute.
Unseenamerica NYS is a photography and writing workshop class offered to working men and women across New York by the Workforce Development Institute.

12 boxes of photographs, negatives, and printed material from unseen America: New York State, a project showcasing the lives and experiences of workers. Photographic prints include 10x15 black and white prints and 4x6 color and black and white photos. Box 12 contains a binder with photocopies of proofs from boxes 1-5. Photographs were taken beween 2004 and 2010 in many cities and towns in upstate New York, including Albany, Binghamton, Buffalo, Gloversville, Poughkeepsie, Purchase, and Utica. A project collaboration between the Workforce Development Institute, Bread & Roses, and SEIU/1199.

The Workforce Development Institute (WDI) is a New York State nonprofit that provides programs in workforce, economic, and community development in order to improve the lives of working families around the State. The WDI Art of Labor program provides photography, writing, and art workshops to capture stories of workers across New York. Unseenamerica NYS is a 10-12 week photography and writing workshop class offered to working men and women across New York.
Donated by the Workforce Development Institute, under an agreement with Ed Murphy (executive director), 2011. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.034.

Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
